Lay Summary: Overall elevated glucose with frequent time-above-range.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Correlates with higher A1C and complications; guides therapy escalation.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=TAR>180; cond=>30%; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Frequent/prolonged lows across days.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Indicates overtreatment or timing mismatch; risk of severe events.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=TBR; cond=GEQ4PCT or ANY_<54; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Large day-to-day swings/high IQR bands.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Linked to symptoms and complications; aim to reduce variability.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=CV; cond=>=36%; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Good overall control with narrow AGP bands.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports maintenance, consider de-intensification if appropriate.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=COMBO(TIR,CV); cond=(TIR>=70 & CV<36); repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Lows during sleep period.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Prevent nocturnal events.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[00:00–06:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Lows shortly after waking.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Avoid morning impairment.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[06:00–08:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Mid-morning lows between meals.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Add protein/fat in breakfast or adjust meds.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports workday function.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[10:00–12:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Afternoon dip potentially from lunch bolus.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Reduces afternoon lows.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[14:00–16:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Lows before dinner.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Avoid late corrections; add snack if needed.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Prevents rebound eating.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[17:00–19:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Evening lows after dinner.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Reduce evening risk.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[19:00–22:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Lows in hours before sleep.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Prevents overnight cascade.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[20:00–23:00]; metric=TIME_<70; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Overnight low triggers rebound morning high.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Prevents wrong insulin adjustments.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[00:00–08:00]; metric=SEQUENCE_LOW_THEN_HIGH; cond=(LOW<70>=15min THEN rise>=100 within 2–4h); repeat=GEQ2D

Lay Summary: Lows during or after exercise (immediate or delayed).
Clinical Teaching Note: *Plan carbs or dose reduction around exercise.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Reduces activity-related risks.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=relative[0–24h]; metric=LOW_EVENT; cond=any <70; repeat=GEQ2 EVENTS

Lay Summary: Early morning rise (4–8 AM) without food.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Explains fasting highs.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[04:00–08:00]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=60min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Rapid rise and high peak within ~1h; returns by ~3h.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Informs meal planning, bolus timing, and medication response.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–180]; metric=DELTA/PEAK/TTP; cond=(Δ>=60 & PEAK>180 & return<=180); repeat=GEQ40PCT meals

Lay Summary: Highs after late dinner/snacks.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Improves fasting when addressed.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[22:00–02:00]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=60min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Rise after breakfast window.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Targets morning routine.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[09:00–11:00]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=60min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Rise post‑lunch window.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Reduces post‑lunch spikes.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[13:00–16:00]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=60min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Rise post‑dinner window.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Reduces evening highs.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[18:00–21:00]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=60min; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Small early change but late sustained rise after high‑fat/protein meal.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Informs meal planning, bolus timing, and medication response.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–180]; metric=Δ_0_60, Δ_90_180, P50; cond=(<20, >=50, >140); repeat=GEQ40PCT HF meals

Lay Summary: Sustained post‑meal elevation >3h.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Informs meal planning, bolus timing, and medication response.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–360]; metric=TIME_>180; cond=>=180min; repeat=GEQ40PCT meals

Lay Summary: Two peaks or oscillations after meal.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Informs meal planning, bolus timing, and medication response.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–360]; metric=OSC_COUNT; cond=>=2 peaks or >=3 osc; repeat=GEQ40PCT meals

Lay Summary: Small excursion and fast return.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Informs meal planning, bolus timing, and medication response.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–180]; metric=PEAK/TTP; cond=(PEAK<=140 & return<=120); repeat=GEQ40PCT meals

Lay Summary: Stable weekdays but unstable weekends (or vice versa).
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Targets specific days for intervention.
Rule Definition (1-line): Weekend CV or TAR > weekday baseline + threshold
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=CV/TAR; cond=weekend >= weekday + delta; repeat=GEQ2 weekends

Lay Summary: Higher variance and swings in evening block.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Often linked to large dinners or stress.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Focus stabilization where volatility is highest.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=clock[18:00–22:00]; metric=IQR & CV; cond=IQR>40 or CV>36; repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: One-time extreme high glucose event (>300 mg/dL) not sustained over following days.
Clinical Teaching Note: Confirm if recurrent; may reflect missed dose or heavy meal.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Detects acute, clinically relevant spikes that may not affect averages but warrant review.
Detection Rule (Structured): max_glucose_day >300 AND duration_above_250 <120min

Lay Summary: One-time episode of severe hypoglycemia without repetition.
Clinical Teaching Note: Review for sulfonylurea or insulin overcorrection.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Important for identifying isolated dangerous lows even when TBR <1%.
Detection Rule (Structured): time_below_54 >15min on 1 day in 14

Lay Summary: Short-term spike or dip with no obvious trigger in logs.
Clinical Teaching Note: May indicate logging gap or data artifact.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Promotes review of missing contextual data.
Rule Definition (1-line): Excursion >80 mg/dL unexplained by logged events.
Detection Rule (Structured): delta_glucose>80mg/dL in 30min and no log within ±60min

Lay Summary: Rapid glucose increase suggesting high GI food or stress surge.
Clinical Teaching Note: Consider meal composition or emotional stress triggers.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Early identifier of reactive hyperglycemia.
Detection Rule (Structured): delta_glucose_15min >80

Lay Summary: Sharp glucose drop likely linked to insulin timing or activity.
Clinical Teaching Note: Warns of hypoglycemia risk post insulin or exercise.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Highlights overcorrection or sensitivity patterns.
Detection Rule (Structured): delta_glucose_15min < -60

Lay Summary: One-off prolonged hyperglycemia lasting >4h without repeat.
Clinical Teaching Note: Investigate skipped meds, illness, or stress day.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Detects rare sustained highs that may distort averages.
Detection Rule (Structured): time_above_250 ≥240min on 1 day

Lay Summary: Glucose highly unstable within one day but averages normalize over week.
Clinical Teaching Note: Look for lifestyle or stress-related drivers.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Identifies erratic days that increase overall glycemic risk.
Rule Definition (1-line): Any day with CV >36% but 7d mean CV <36%.
Detection Rule (Structured): daily_cv >36 AND mean_7d_cv <36

Lay Summary: Physiology-violating ROC.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Removes artifacts to prevent false inferences.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=ROC; cond=|Δ|>5 for >=10; repeat=GEQ1D

Lay Summary: Abrupt shift at new sensor start.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Removes artifacts to prevent false inferences.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; window=±2h swap; metric=LEVEL_STEP; cond=>=25; repeat=GEQ1 EVENT

Lay Summary: Whole day too noisy to trust.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Removes artifacts to prevent false inferences.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=CGM; metric=NOISE_IDX; cond=>95th pct; repeat=GEQ1D

Lay Summary: Overnight lows with daytime OK.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[00:00–06:00]; metric=TBR & daytime_TIR; cond=(LOW>=15min AND TIR>=70%); repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Fasting high with stable daytime.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[04:00–08:00]; metric=P50 & TIR; cond=(P50>140 & TIR>=70%); repeat=GEQ40PCT

Lay Summary: Midday–evening highs on steroid days; overnight stable.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Rule Definition (1-line): Day mean↑≥15 vs baseline; overnight stable.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[08:00–22:00]; metric=MEAN_DAY & overnight_stable; cond=day_mean↑>=15; repeat=GEQ2D

Lay Summary: Large early spike without timely bolus.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Rule Definition (1-line): Δ≥60 in 60min & peak>180; bolus late>20min or none.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+LOGS+CGM; window=rel[0–180]; metric=DELTA/PEAK & bolus_timing; cond=combo; repeat=GEQ2 meals

Lay Summary: Multiple corrections → later low.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[18:00–03:00]; metric=CORRECTION_COUNT_THEN_LOW; cond=>=2 then LOW; repeat=GEQ2D

Lay Summary: Sudden overnight high after missed basal.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[04:00–08:00]; metric=FASTING & basal_log; cond=FASTING>160 & gap; repeat=GEQ1D

Lay Summary: Reduced post‑meal peaks after start.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=rel[0–180]; metric=POSTMEAL_MEDIAN_DELTA; cond=↓>=20; repeat=GEQ1WEEK

Lay Summary: Progressive flattening during escalation.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Rule Definition (1-line): Downward slope in post‑meal median over 2–4w.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=weeks[2–4]; metric=TREND_POSTMEAL; cond=neg_slope; repeat=GEQ1WEEK

Lay Summary: Lower mean and highs after initiation.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[00:00–24:00]; metric=MEAN & P75; cond=both↓>=10; repeat=GEQ1WEEK

Lay Summary: Daytime lows without bolus insulin.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[06:00–22:00]; metric=TIME_<70 & SU_flag; cond=>=15min; repeat=GEQ2D

Lay Summary: Highs despite appropriate dosing.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+CGM; window=clock[00:00–24:00]; metric=TAR & response; cond=combo; repeat=GEQ14D

Lay Summary: Higher variability and mean during/after illness.
Clinical Teaching Note: *Confirm with EHR context before dose changes.*
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Connects CGM shifts to therapy decisions.
Rule Definition (1-line): Mean↑≥10 or CV↑≥10pp over 3–7d vs baseline.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=EHR+LOGS+CGM; window=days[3–7]; metric=MEAN & CV delta; cond=thresholds; repeat=GEQ1 episode

Lay Summary: AM/PM pattern flips on work nights.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Rule Definition (1-line): AGP curves inverted vs baseline on shift days.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=shift_days; metric=CIRCADIAN_SHIFT; cond=pattern flip; repeat=GEQ2 weeks

Lay Summary: Multiple small peaks due to grazing.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=weekends; metric=OSC_COUNT; cond=>=3; repeat=GEQ2 weekends

Lay Summary: Higher glucose after short sleep.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Rule Definition (1-line): Mean↑≥10 vs personal baseline next day.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=next_day; metric=MEAN_DELTA; cond=↑>=10; repeat=GEQ2 nights

Lay Summary: Transient rises with high stress.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Rule Definition (1-line): Mean or P75↑≥10 during stress window.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=event; metric=MEAN/P75; cond=↑>=10; repeat=GEQ2 events

Lay Summary: Evening dip or overnight low after alcohol.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=rel[6–12h]; metric=LOW; cond=any <70; repeat=GEQ2 events

Lay Summary: Higher glucose on low hydration days.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Rule Definition (1-line): Mean↑≥10 on days with low hydration tag.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=day; metric=MEAN; cond=↑>=10; repeat=GEQ2 days

Lay Summary: Pattern varies by cycle phase.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Rule Definition (1-line): Mean or variability shift by phase.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=phase; metric=MEAN/CV; cond=shift by phase; repeat=GEQ2 cycles

Lay Summary: Higher glucose on hot days.
Usefulness / Clinical Significance: Supports non‑pharmacologic strategies.
Detection Rule (Structured): input=LOGS+CGM; window=day; metric=MEAN; cond=↑>=10; repeat=GEQ2 days
